snippet: Determined to use their water as cautiously as possible, state officials say they will cut off the water provided to local agencies serving 25 million residents. Those agencies will have to rely on other sources.
abstract: California state officials say they will cut off the water to local agencies serving 25 million residents and about 750,000 acres of farmland, in response to one of worst droughts in history; most of the 29 agencies affected have other sources they can draw from, such as groundwater and local reservoirs.
lead_paragraph: Determined to use their water as cautiously as possible, state officials say they will cut off the water provided to local agencies serving 25 million residents. Those agencies will have to rely on other sources.

headline.main: Parched, California Cuts Off Tap to Agencies
headline.print_headline: Parched, California Cuts Off Tap to Agencies
